main event: On August 4th, 1952, Technical Sergeant John F. Skinner reported sighting an object in Colorado Springs, CO, traveling at approximately 2000 MPH, appearing to be the size of a regulation baseball, and observed for 15 to 30 seconds.
interesting points: The object appeared to be traveling at an incredibly high speed of 2000 MPH.
It was approximately the size of a regulation baseball.
The sighting was reported by a Technical Sergeant of the USAF, stationed at Peterson Field, Colorado Springs, CO.
The sighting was requested to be evaluated by ATIC.
The report described the object as circular and very fast.
photographs: no, the report does not include photographs
